(I shift in my chair, a slight chuckle) I’m a natural leader, you know? I like to take charge, to make decisions, to guide the team. And sometimes, that can come across as… controlling. I’ve learned that over the years.

(I lean forward, a touch of earnestness in my voice) The truth is, I’ve realized that I’m actually *more* effective when I cooperate with others. When I listen to their ideas, when I value their input, when I work together as a team.

(I pause, a thoughtful expression on my face) It’s about recognizing that I don’t have all the answers. That everyone brings something unique to the table. And that by combining our strengths, we can achieve more than we could ever achieve on our own.

(I lean forward, a touch of sincerity in my voice) I’ve learned to be more open to collaboration. To be more willing to compromise. To be more willing to admit when I’m wrong. It’s not always easy – I still have a tendency to want to be in charge – but I’m trying.

That’s… a really good question. And… honestly? Yes. Absolutely. Yes, I am easily distracted. It’s… it’s a well-known trait, I think.

(I shift in my chair, a slight blush creeping up my neck.) I’m a people person, you know? I love being around people, hearing their stories, getting involved in their conversations.
